oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The landmark "Brown" v. "Board of Education" decision by the U.S. Supreme Court in 1954 established that separate schools for black and white students are unequal and thus unconstitutional. Individuals and groups opposed to school desegregation embarked on a plan of massive resistance, which ranged from public speeches like this one to the bombing of school buildings.
